statements: UPDATE wine_reviews SET rating = 5 WHERE review_id = 1;
UPDATE wine_reviews SET reviewer_name = 'Alice', winery_name = 'Vineyard XYZ' WHERE review_id = 3;
UPDATE wine_reviews SET rating = 5, reviewer_name = 'John Doe' WHERE review_id = 1
UPDATE wine_reviews SET winery_name = 'XYZ Winery', rating = 7 WHERE reviewer_name = 'Alice Smith'
UPDATE WineReviews SET rating = 4.5, review_text = 'Delightful taste' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Reviewers SET email = 'newemail@example.com', country = 'Australia' WHERE reviewer_id = 3;
UPDATE WineReviews SET rating = 4.5, review_text = 'Great wine!' WHERE id = 123
UPDATE Reviewers SET email = 'newemail@example.com', country = 'France' WHERE reviewer_id = 456
UPDATE wine_reviews SET rating = 4.5, review_text = 'Great wine!' WHERE review_id = 1;
UPDATE wine_regions SET climate = 'Mild', soil_type = 'Loamy' WHERE region_id = 3;
UPDATE wine_reviews SET rating = 4.5, review_text = 'Great wine with a smooth finish' WHERE review_id = 123;
UPDATE wine_regions SET soil_type = 'Sandy loam', country = 'France' WHERE region_id = 456;
UPDATE Wine SET country='Italy', type='Red' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE Review SET rating=4, taste_notes='Balanced and fruity' WHERE id=2;
UPDATE Wine SET country = 'France', region = 'Burgundy' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Review SET rating = 95, reviewer = 'WineConnoisseur', taste_notes = 'Smooth and fruity' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE Wines SET wine_type = 'Red' WHERE wine_id = 1;
UPDATE Winemakers SET winery_name = 'New Winery' WHERE winemaker_id = 3;
UPDATE Wines SET wine_name = 'Chardonnay', wine_type = 'White', wine_region = 'California' WHERE wine_id = 1;
UPDATE Ratings SET rating = 4.5, tasting_notes = 'Fruity with hints of oak' WHERE wine_id = 2 AND taster_id = 1;
